item.title: eBus - TTL
item.description:
This adapter is designed to connect an eBus compatible boiler to any TTL port (TTL-USB, ESP8266, ESP32, Arduino, etc).

Same size as popular RS485-TTL module for more compatibility.

As a software part, you can use ebusd with different connection types:

  • TTL-UART - you need converter that doesn’t buffer too much data (CP2102 or FTDI based (like FT232)) ğŸ‘
  • ESP8266 / ESP32 enhanced ebusd protocol using ebusd-esp firmware (only Wi-Fi connection now) ğŸ‰
  • Raspberry Pi internal UART port can be used with some preparations,
    but I recommend ttyebus kernel module which is with the lowest latency possible ğŸš€
  • ser2net compatible firmware (ESPEasy, ESP-Link, ESPHome, Tasmota, etc) or hardware converter with some restrictions (Receive - OK; Transmit - may be errors) ğŸ¤”

Also available HA integration between ebusd daemon and Home Assistant ğŸš

item.title: OpenTherm - TTL
item.description:
This adapter is designed to connect an OpenTherm compatible boiler to any TTL port (TTL-USB, ESP8266, ESP32, Arduino, etc).

Same size as popular RS485-TTL module for more compatibility.

As software part you can use:

  • OpenTherm gateway for HomeAssistant - very intelligent OT control firmware ğŸ§ 
  • Tasmota OpenTherm - perhaps the easiest way to connect the boiler to your smart home system ğŸš
  • Opentherm IO library for Arduino or OpenTherm Arduino/ESP8266 Library (slave mode only)
    if you want to build your own firmware ğŸ›
